verses.plain: If thou be made the master of a feast, lift not thyself up, but be among them as one of the rest; take diligent care for them, and so sit down.

tokens.t: If thou be made the master
, lift not thyself up, but be among them as one of the rest; take diligent care for them, and so sit down.

verses.plain: And when thou hast done all thy office, take thy place, that thou mayest be merry with them, and receive a crown for thy well ordering of the feast.

tokens.t: And when thou hast done all thy office, take thy place, that thou mayest be merry with them, and receive a crown for thy well ordering of the feast.

verses.plain: Speak, thou that art the elder, for it becometh thee, but with sound judgment; and hinder not musick.

tokens.t: Speak, thou that art the elder, for it becometh thee, but with sound judgment; and hinder not musick.

verses.plain: Pour not out words where there is a musician, and shew not forth wisdom out of time.

tokens.t: Pour not out words where there is a musician, and shew not forth wisdom out of time.

verses.plain: A concert of musick in a banquet of wine is as a signet of carbuncle set in gold.

tokens.t: A concert of musick in a banquet of wine is as a signet of carbuncle set in gold.

verses.plain: As a signet of an emerald set in a work of gold, so is the melody of musick with pleasant wine.

tokens.t: As a signet of an emerald set in a work of gold, so is the melody of musick with pleasant wine.

verses.plain: Speak, young man, if there be need of thee: and yet scarcely when thou art twice asked.

tokens.t: Speak, young man, if there be need of thee: and yet scarcely when thou art twice asked.

verses.plain: Let thy speech be short, comprehending much in few words; be as one that knoweth and yet holdeth his tongue.

tokens.t: Let thy speech be short, comprehending much in few words; be as one that knoweth and yet holdeth his tongue.

verses.plain: If thou be among great men, make not thyself equal with them; and when ancient men are in place, use not many words.

tokens.t: If thou be among great men, make not thyself equal with them; and when ancient men are in place, use not many words.

verses.plain: Before the thunder goeth lightning; and before a shamefaced man shall go favour.

tokens.t: Before the thunder goeth lightning; and before a shamefaced man shall go favour.

verses.plain: Rise up betimes, and be not the last; but get thee home without delay.

tokens.t: Rise up betimes, and be not the last; but get thee home without delay.

verses.plain: There take thy pastime, and do what thou wilt: but sin not by proud speech.

tokens.t: There take thy pastime, and do what thou wilt: but sin not by proud speech.

verses.plain: And for these things bless him that made thee, and hath replenished thee with his good things.

tokens.t: And for these things bless him that made thee, and hath replenished thee with his good things.

verses.plain: Whoso feareth the Lord will receive his discipline; and they that seek him early shall find favour.

tokens.t: Whoso feareth the Lord will receive his discipline; and they that seek him early shall find favour.

verses.plain: He that seeketh the law shall be filled therewith: but the hypocrite will be offended thereat.

tokens.t: He that seeketh the law shall be filled therewith: but the hypocrite will be offended thereat.

verses.plain: They that fear the Lord shall find judgment, and shall kindle justice as a light.

tokens.t: They that fear the Lord shall find judgment, and shall kindle justice as a light.

verses.plain: A sinful man will not be reproved, but findeth an excuse according to his will.

tokens.t: A sinful man will not be reproved, but findeth an excuse according to his will.

verses.plain: A man of counsel will be considerate; but a strange and proud man is not daunted with fear, even when of himself he hath done without counsel.

tokens.t: A man of counsel will be considerate; but a strange and proud man is not daunted with fear, even when of himself he hath done without counsel.

verses.plain: Do nothing without advice; and when thou hast once done, repent not.

tokens.t: Do nothing without advice; and when thou hast once done, repent not.

verses.plain: Go not in a way wherein thou mayest fall, and stumble not among the stones.

tokens.t: Go not in a way wherein thou mayest fall, and stumble not among the stones.

verses.plain: Be not confident in a plain way.

tokens.t: Be not confident in a plain way.

verses.plain: And beware of thine own children.

tokens.t: And beware of thine own children.

verses.plain: In every good work trust thy own soul; for this is the keeping of the commandments.

tokens.t: In every good work trust thy own soul; for this is the keeping of the commandments.

verses.plain: He that believeth in the Lord taketh heed to the commandment; and he that trusteth in him shall fare never the worse.

tokens.t: He that believeth in the Lord taketh heed to the commandment; and he that trusteth in him shall fare never the worse.
